Ingredients.9: 2 cups peanut oil, or as needed

Ingredients.10: 1 salt and ground black pepper to taste

Directions.1: Soak chicken tenders in buttermilk for 20 to 30 minutes in the refrigerator.

Directions.2: While chicken is soaking, combine flour, salt, garlic salt, mustard powder, paprika, and pepper in a large brown bag.

Directions.3: Heat oil in a deep-fryer or large saucepan to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).

Directions.4: Drain chicken and shake lightly to remove excess buttermilk. Chicken should still be damp. Drop chicken into the bag of seasoned flour and shake until well-coated.

Directions.5: Drop chicken into hot oil in batches, about 6 pieces at a time, depending on the size of your pot. Cook until golden brown, crispy, and no longer pink in the center, 6 to 8 minutes. Remove from oil and drain on paper towels. Sprinkle with salt and pepper while still warm.
